turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Ceremonial Drum of the Senufo People.
turn.1: What was the Ceremonial Drum of the Senufo People ?
turn.2: Ceremonial Drum of the Senufo People The Senufo people whom live along the Ivory Coast in Africa created the ceremonial drum.
turn.3: What was the purpose of the drum?
turn.4: The drum represents various aspects of tradition and life for certain Senufo communities.
turn.5: Is there anything else interesting about the drum?
turn.6: The construction of the drum is particularly indicative of the roles of women within Senufo communities and how they seen as "preservers of life" those that hold up the structure and spirituality which govern their world.
turn.7: Why are women seen as preservers?
turn.8: In fact, of the four Senufo societies, which educate and govern the individual acts of people, the divination governing "sandogo" society is composed mostly of women.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: It is worth noting that Senufo culture is matrilineal and certain societal positions such as the artisans, are determined by matrilineal inheritance.
turn.11: What else do you find interesting about this article?
turn.12: While ruled by elder male leaders, one's place in society, as well as their position for the future, is determined by the lineage of the mother.
